body:
> I don't have an answer for that at the moment, but as we've been doing that on Juju for some time now and found it terrible (duplicate imports, huge diffs twiddling import paths, weird errors when two values are not equal because they come from different copies of the same package), I really hope people haven't been taking that advice seriously.

I believe it depends on how widely a project is used.

For an established stable package that is used by numerous other apps and packages (e.g. all packages in the Go standard library) not changing the import path would be much more painful than changing it.

For an experimental package or a package that is not widely used yet the story is opposite.

Of course there are many packages that are in between these two extremes.
